import Mathlib

open Filter

variable {I : Set â„} {f : â„ â†’ â„} {c : â„}

/-- If f is differentiable at c (with c in I), then f has a linear approximation there.
    There exist real a and b such that for every Îµ>0 there is Î´>0 with
    |a + b*(x-c) - f x| â‰¤ Îµ * |x-c| whenever x âˆˆ I and |x-c| < Î´.
    Equivalently, there exists g : â„ â†’ â„ with tendsto g (nhdsWithin c I) (nhds 0)
    and for x âˆˆ I, x â‰  c, |a + b*(x-c) - f x| = |x-c| * g x. -/
theorem differentiable_at_linear_approx (hI : c âˆˆ I) (hf : DifferentiableAt â„ f c) :
  âˆƒ a b : â„,
    (âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ x âˆˆ I, |x - c| < Î´ â†’ |a + b * (x - c) - f x| â‰¤ Îµ * |x - c|) âˆ§
    (âˆƒ g : â„ â†’ â„, Tendsto g (nhdsWithin c I) (nhds 0) âˆ§ âˆ€ x âˆˆ I, x â‰  c â†’ |a + b * (x - c) - f x| = |x - c| * g x) := by sorry
